data.title: Just what I was hoping for
data.text:
I try Philly Cheesesteaks wherever I go (along with Gyros and Massaman Curry, Phad Thai and cheeseburgers). I would guess I've had over 25 cheesesteaks from around the country, inculding Philadelphia (Geno's) and would have this up in my top 3. Some days they taste like #1. There's a grill in Winston-Salem, NC that is my favorite, but nostalgia may inflate my belief.
A great cheesesteak sandwich starts with great bread and there's is close to perfect. I love their menu and all the different varieties of hot smothered sandwiches. I think the service is great and I couldn't be more satisfied.
Try and make your own mind up. I know you want be disappointed.

data.title: Great Sandwich Great Service Great Prices
data.text:
I'm from Philly. I like my cheesesteak with pickled pepper rings. They carry them! I like my roll grilled. They do it. Franklin's makes a great sandwich, and the staff makes you glad that you choose to eat there. 
Keep in mind that Amoroso's bakery is not right around the corner . The rolls won't be as crisp at if you were eating a sandwich at Pat's or Tony Luke's. It is still the best Cheesesteak this side of the Rockies. Terrific folks, food & fun.
 It is a must try!

data.title: Yum
data.text: We got the Philly cheesesteak and small fries to go and it was plenty for the two of us to share. The seasoning on the fries was great and the sub was super tasty. Sauce was also very tasty. We would certainly return.

data.title: A variety of cheese steaks are available.
data.text: They are located just across the street from the Museum of Idaho. I have been here several times and have always found the service and food to be excellent. The Idaho Philly was delightfully different. They now have Blue Bunny Ice Cream Shakes. The Caramel one was very tasty. I felt bad for the gal who made the shake though. I guess the mixing blade wasn't on correctly so as she was making my shake it came off and sent shake everywhere, including on her. They were able to get things cleaned up and a new shake out to me in short order. I hope that this experience doesn't stick with the gal. Accidents happen all the time. She handled it well and very professionally for someone as young as she was. That is not seen in her age group a lot these days. Kudos to Franklin's for finding her and giving her a chance.

data.title: Not what I expected
data.text: I love cheesesteaks and was expecting an awesome experience at this restaurant since it has "famous" in its name.  The day I went they were out of the rolls for the sandwiches which was an immediate disappointment.  In our party we ordered 3 different sandwiches, but they all seemed to look and taste the same.  Something to be aware of is that the price for the sandwich only includes the sandwich and you have to order fries or other sides for an additional cost.  For the price of the sandwich I was expecting to leave feeling satisfied... I was disappointed again!

data.title: Philly in Idaho Falls
data.text: Great spot for lunch. The menu is wide and the ingredients are fresh. Good break from the normal routine.

data.title: Excellent food!!
data.text: We loved this place!  The Kansas city BBQ with chicken was awesome!!  And the Santa few was tasty too!!  Large fry fed two of us.  And they have fry sauce!!!  Defiantly going to be a regular here!!

data.title: Must try!
data.text: Ate there today for first but certainly not last time. It's a funky hole in the wall cafe, bare bones, but food was awesome. I had the NY pastrami and my husband had the philly. Mine was more generous w/meat but flavors on both were delicious! A great local place w/lots of choices. Sometimes nothing is better than freshly made sandwich w/good ingredients. Reminded me of delis back home in the Midwest. I hope everyone tried it. I'm so sick of chain restaurants. Let's support the local businesses!

data.title: Not a true Philly cheesesteak
data.text: Drove by this place a few times. Decided to stop and try it. Friendly service, but the meat was a pot roast consistency.  Very dry. Maybe the burgers are good?

data.title: Great cheesesteak!
data.text:
Good food, friendly service, great value.  Right across the street from the museum.  
Support your local small business!!
